page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: {Bishopston}lies in S. Gower, 8km. to the S.W. of{Swansea.}Carboniferous Limestone and Millstone Grit are the most important rock types.The land surface lies 60-80 m. above the sea & was formed when S.L. was higher than it is today.The surface is cut into by valleys containing{"disappearing {streams"}where the water sinks into the limestone. The{coastline}is clifflike & forms a series of bays. Limestone gives{fertile soils,}on which mixed farming takes place. The Millstone Grit is left as{common land & is used for grazing animals. The {climate}is warm,temperate & humid with only occasional frosts. The last 25 years has seen a rash of house{building}which,with the increase in{tourism}has put the countryside under stress.Hopefully{A.O.N.B.}status will help preserve it for the future.
